description: Single storey rear extension; basement excavation; roof extension to side roof slope (eastern); three rooflights to side roof slope (western); replacement roof tiles; installation of two side elevational windows (western); boundary fence; and demolition of existing garage
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: P00 (Proposed Site Plan); P00A (Proposed Basement Floor Plan); P01 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); P02 (Proposed First Floor Plan); P03 (Proposed Second Floor Plan); P04 (Proposed Roof Plan); P05 (Proposed Front Elevation Facing South Parade); P06 Rev A (Proposed Side Elevation Facing St Albans Ave); P07 Rev A (Proposed Rear Elevation); P08 (Proposed Section AA); P09 (Proposed Front Lightwell Detail); P10 (Proposed Front Garden Plan); P11 (Proposed Rear Garden Plan).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| The hereby approved rooflights to the roof slope of the hereby development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according IAQM (2024) Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- delivery locations,
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works, in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.
The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies D14 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy | Prior to the commencement of development, a Basement Impact Assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, to demonstrate no impact to ground water flowpaths. The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To reduce the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties and local area, in accordance with Policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policies SI 12 and SI 13 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2024).

| Prior to the commencement of development, sustainable surface water drainage detailed plans and maintenance plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plans shall achieve compliance with greenfield run-off rates (1 l/s) and shall demonstrate a reduction of flood risk (betterment of existing drainage) at the site through sustainable drainage mitigation techniques. Approved details shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and permanently retained and maintained.

Reason:  To reduce surface water run-off and the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with Policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policies SI 12 and SI 13 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2024).
